ktn_analysis.coarse_ktn_analysis¶

Main Python script to estimate and analyse a coarse transition network Usage: python coarse_ktn_analysis.py <n_nodes> <n_edges> <n_comms> requires 4x input data files

Daniel J. Sharpe Sep 2019

class ktn_analysis.coarse_ktn_analysis.Coarse_ktn(parent_ktn)[source]¶

Construct a coarse network given the communities and inter-node transition rates for the full network from which it is to be derived. Note that a Coarse_ktn object has an empty edgelist that includes all inter-community transitions in a different order compared to Ktn objects read from a file. Note that Ktn.construct_coarse_ktn(…) is overridden here. Thus Ktn.construct_coarse_ktn() cannot be called from the Coarse_ktn derived class, as is desirable.

__init__(parent_ktn)[source]¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

class ktn_analysis.coarse_ktn_analysis.Edge(edge_id, ts_id, ktn=None)[source]¶

The Edge class provides a representation of an edge in a KTN, where each edge weight is log(transition probability). Each edge also represents a transition state connecting two minima (nodes), whose energy is stored. Reactive flux between nodes are also calculated.

edge_id¶

int – edge ID (NB is unique and indexed from 1)

ts_id¶

int – transition state ID (bidirectional edges will share the same ts ID)

ts_en¶

float – transition state energy

k¶

float – log(transition rate), \(k_{ij}\)

t¶

float – transition probability, i.e. branching probability \(P_{ij}\)

j¶

float – Net flux — still confused about this one

f¶

float – reactive flux

fe¶

float – net reactive flux

deadts¶

bool – flag to indicate dead transition state, aka this edge form a self-loop

to_node¶

Node object – which node edge is pointing to

from_node¶

Node object – which node edge is coming from

__rev_edge¶

Edge object – reverse edge corresponding to from_node <- to_node

ktn¶

Ktn object – reference to the Ktn object to which the Edge belongs

__init__(edge_id, ts_id, ktn=None)[source]¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

static calc_f(node1, node2)[source]¶

does this actually calculate f_ij^AB?

static calc_fe(edge1, edge2)[source]¶

Calculate effective current in Metzner 2.33, :math:`f_{ij}^+ = max(f_{ij}^{AB} - f_{ji}^{AB}, 0).

Parameters:
  • edge1 (Edge object) – edge from node j to node i
  • edge2 (Edge object) – edge from node i to node j
static calc_j(edge1, edge2)[source]¶

what is this referring to?

edge_attribs¶
fe = None

what is a dead transition state?

class ktn_analysis.coarse_ktn_analysis.Ktn(n_nodes, n_edges, n_comms)[source]¶

The Ktn class provides a representation of a kinetic transition network with a pre-specified number of nodes, edges, and communities into which nodes are partitioned.

n_nodes¶

int – Number of nodes in network

n_edges¶

int – number of bidirectional edges

n_comms¶

int – number of communities into which nodes are partitioned

nodelist¶

(n_nodes,) list – list of Node objects in KTN

edgelist¶

(n_edges,) list – list of Edge objects in KTN

dbalance¶

bool – Flag to indicate if detailed balance holds. Defaults to False.

A¶

set – endpoint nodes in the set A

B¶

set – endpoint nodes in the set B

__init__(n_nodes, n_edges, n_comms)[source]¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

static check_edge_reverse(edge1, edge2)[source]¶
static check_if_edge(edge)[source]¶
static check_if_node(node)[source]¶
construct_coarse_ktn()[source]¶
construct_ktn(comms, conns, pi, k, node_ens, ts_ens)[source]¶

Construct a KTN.

Parameters:
  • comms (array-like) – Should be same length as number of nodes? so guestting community IDs of each node. Don’t worry about this for now.
  • conns ((n_edges, 2) array-like) – specifies connections between nodes. conns[i][0] specifies from_node of edge i and conns[i][1] specifies to_node of edge i.
  • pi ((n_nodes,) list) – equilibrium occupation probabilities of all nodes in KTN
  • k ((2*n_edges,) list) – rates ordered such that k[i] and k[i+1] specificy forward and rate and backward rate for edge between nodes i and i+1.
  • node_ens ((n_nodes,) list[float]) – energies of nodes in KTN
  • ts_ens ((n_edges,) list[float]) – TS energies, one for each bidirectional edge.

Eq. 2.20 in Metzner

write_nodes_info()[source]¶

dump relevant node information to files: eigenvectors, eigenvector errors, communities. If called from a Coarse_ktn object, then data for both the coarse and parent KTN objects is written.

class ktn_analysis.coarse_ktn_analysis.Node(node_id, ktn=None)[source]¶

The Node class represents a single node in a kinetic transition network (KTN), where each node is a potential energy minima of the free energy landscape.

node_id¶

int – node ID. NB indexed from 1

node_en¶

float – node energy

comm_id¶

int – community ID. NB indexed from 0

pi¶

float – log of the node stationary probability

mr¶

float – reactive trajectory current

qf¶

float – node forward committor probability

qb¶

float – node backward committor probability

k_esc¶

float – sum of transition rates out of node (node out-degree)

k_in¶

float – sum of transition rates into node (node in-degree)

t¶

float – self-transition probability, \(P_{ii}\).

nbrlist¶

list – list of neighboring nodes via TO edges that flow towards node

edgelist_in¶

list – list of edges TO node

edgelist_out¶

list – list of edges FROM node

evec¶

list[float] – list of values for the dominant eigenvectors

ktn¶

ktn – reference to the Ktn object to which the Node belongsa

__init__(node_id, ktn=None)[source]¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

calc_k_esc_in(mode=0)[source]¶

Calculate the escape rate and total in rate for each node. Escape rate defined as \(\sum_j k_{ji}\) and total in rate defined as \(\sum_l k_{il}\).

Parameters:mode (int [0 or 1]) – If mode is 1, only calculate escape rate. Defaults to 0.
static calc_mr(node, dbalance=False)[source]¶

Calculate the probability distribution of reactive trajectories defined in Metzner et al. 2009 in eqn. 2.11, \(m_i^R = \pi_i q_i^+ q_i^-\). If detailed balance applies, this reduces to \(m_i^R = \pi_i q_i^+ (1 - q_i^+)\).

Parameters:dbalance (Bool) – Whether or not detailed balance condition applies at this node, meaning \(\pi_i K_{ij} = \pi_j K_{ij}\). Defaults to False.
calc_node_t()[source]¶

Calculate self-transition probability for node, i.e. \(P_{ii} = 1 - \sum_j P_{ji}\).

node_attribs¶
tpt_vals¶

Return TPT values for this node.
